reviews.review_msg: Recently changed the grading scheme so that majority of your grade comes from group projects so your grade mostly depends on your group :/. Travis does rely way too much on the TAS especially Whitney and it gets weird and obnoxious. The case assignment is marked pretty tough so make sure to get feedback for every single part. Lectures are useless

not everyone can do well in group projects, my group sucked, and i couldn't do anything
! entire semester was the same group and so many assignments , anyway, AND WHITNEY!! lets not go they, i dont even wanna talk about it, but please get rid of whitney travis

i was suffocated in that class, lets understand this tht not evrybdy social every student has their way of learning,understanding,studying, and performing. i have so much and no more words to say for that class at the same time. TRAVIS IS GOOD, and i feel bad for him.1.mostly because of WHITNEY, and 2nd. he needs to plan and tell people what to do

the only thing i didn't like about his class was WHITNEY!  she wouldn't let him speak , he is the prof! and if you get whitney as your TA, get ready to lose mark in everything and literally anything!! and she is very biased, and why does this matter? because travis only listens to her, like why are you even the prof then.

Travis is definitely a nice guy and is clearly passionate about what he teaches. Lectures are almost pointless and for a three-hour time-slot you aren't learning much. Criteria for the group project is vague, while feedback is ambiguous at best and contradictory at worst. Overall, this isn't a must avoid prof., but be prepared for some headaches.

He's a decent prof. Few things to note:
- lecture slides have nothing on them so you need to take good notes
- the marking for the group project felt random and was hard but because the exams were easy it didn't make a huge difference
- exams were very short and easy (if you took notes)
- we did activities in lecture that were sometimes unnecessary
travis is okay

Travis was excellent in my opinion, the only thing that prevents him from getting a five is that he relies too much on the TA in his lectures. I feel that if he was the only one doing the lectures then it would've been a 5/5 professor. Groupwork grading was unnecessarily tough and discouraged a lot of students. Travis is excellent, TAs not so much

I disagree with the comment about ta making marks better. I went to TA and prof multiple times they usually rambled about possibilities without giving any proper explanation or help. no matter how we tried to then explain what we talked about it was never good enough. Or just overall wrong. Would've been nice to learn what was expected of us.

Other than his horrible blank and confusing lecture slides he is a solid professor. Everyone got bad marks on the final assignment, it was his way of "scaling" the class down. For group project assignment always go to T.A. ask for help, it will help your grade

Travis could have been a good professor on his own, relied too much on Whitney (TA) and made lectures difficult to understand. Uncoordinated and asks for options while teaching. You're the Prof, you should know how to lecture without asking for validity. 3 hour lecture: 1 hour of teaching, 1 hour of rambling, and 1 hour of useless presentations.

one of the things that messed up this course was not being able to choose your own groups. also, it's very hard to tell who's the actual prof at times because he relies heavily on TAs to teach the content instead. i walked out of every class feeling like ive learnt nothing from this course, i literally learned more at home. this course is cooked

bro whats the point in doing peer evaluation if you make us submit it as a group ðŸ‘Ž barely acted as the prof for this class. idk what we did half the time since lectures were only 1 hour and classes supposed to be 3. also you cant pick your own groups for this stupid project. marking criteria unclear: you want more detail even with a word limit????
Im sure if he actually taught more of the class and spent less time on confusing activities it would be a much better class

Like this class could be so easy if we were actually taught something. Nothing was taught. Absolutely nothing. No one had a clue about anything and the exam policy is actually dumb like how has it taken this long to reconsider that policy? Class time wasted and final assignments and exams were just graded to drop your mark and ruin your efforts.

he barely taught this class, relied on the tas like 80% of the time. it was frustrating since we had no direction in this course. the criteria for assignments isn't clear since we get deducted for things not even mentioned there. barely any exam prep. these lectures also drag on for so long

I loved Beyonce so much, I had all her merch. I'd pray to Beyonce every night before I go to bed, thanking for the life I've been given. "Beyonce is love", I would say, "Beyonce is life". The people in this class hear me and think I'm delusional. But I know they're just jealous of my devotion for Beyonce.
Great prof

i currently have no idea what to study as lately i dont think i or anyone has really been gaining from his lectures. the ratios and questions i just need a clearer understanding of and theres not much time to as the midterm is already around the corner and he wont be there next week class, which is the last class before the midterm.

His lectures were quite heavy and he expected us to know many concepts and terminology already so he went through it pretty quickly. Group assignments and projects were based on lectures and worth 50% of your grade. The assignments were marked pretty tough and the feedback was confusing. Overall not a bad class if you really put in more effort

This professor was okay. The worst was that the assignments were marked very tough and the comments did not even make sense. You can take HSCI 230 with this professor as he is great at teaching and his lectures are amazing, but make sure you do really good on the assignments otherwise, your grades will drop as he is a tough grader.
he is so caring and kind, he does a lot of in class activities and there is no final, just a final project. all exams are on canvas and really fair. stan beyonce!
Best prof at sfu, definitly reccomend taking courses with him. explains course content amazingly. Exams are really fair and exactly what he covers. he gives lots of hints. He's honestly the best!!!
Best professor at SFU. Wants to make sure his students succeed and never complicates things. Take this class with him if you can it will be a wonderful experience.
Travis is a sweetheart and very considerate students and their well-being. An immaculate teacher! Will for sure take any future courses with him.
Caring and understanding of all/diverse students. Travis is the epitome of a GOOD professor.
Travis is a great professor! he is so helpful in office hours and cares about his students.

Dr. Salway is an incredibly kind professor who genuinely cares about the content in the course. He sent out feedback surveys 4 times during the course to see how he could improve his teaching style to fit the needs of the class. If you have any interest in social epi, or just want a nice professor, take a class with Travis.

Travis is a really caring and kind professor but his grading scale is inflexible where an 89 is considered an A-. Although he makes lectures engaging, the material he explains can almost always be explained in a couple slides. He also tends to assume the class is already aware of all terminology which is a bit harsh for a 200-level class.

3 hour lectures aren't very exciting but Travis makes sure to add really helpful in class activities to keep the class awake and engaged. The exam and assignments are quite fair. There is a lot practice questions in textbook that are very similar to the exam questions which helped a lot. He's a great prof and really cares about his students.

Travis represents educators who genuinely care about future professionals and the future of healthcare. He is a fair grader, and gives visual/interactive examples (i.e. mock studies) in his teaching to help clarify concepts. He definitely wants students to succeed and explains things in such a comprehensive manner!

Travis is probably the best professor I've ever had. He completely reinstated in me the reasons in which I applied to Health Sciences at SFU. He is not just highly accomplished in his field and deeply knowledgeable, but he is compassionate, funny, considerate, and he genuinely creates a safe environment for all his students to learn. LOVE Travis!
Amazing. He makes sure you understand the stuff and lectures are awesome.

Travis is a fantastic professor -- material is challenging and he is a tough, but fair, grader (I nearly failed my final paper). Regardless, I learned an immense amount in his class, and have the utmost respect for him as a teacher. Incredibly inspirational, and got me interested in social epi!

Travis is fantastic. I had him for a graduate course in epidemiology (social epi mostly), and learned an incredible amount. The material is challenging (to me), but he made it very engaging, and my learning was immense. He is a tough, but fair, grader. Travis is the best!
